_header: Hail be glad and joy without end
_description: On the Seven Joys of the Virgin Mary in Heaven — ten 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc)

CULKk16.First Lines:
HEyle be glad & Ioye with outen endeModyr of god to whome he
                    doth honoure…
CULKk16.Last Lines:
…And to þat Ioye þat neuer schall haue ffyneOs gyde
                    & leedeþe ryght redy waye
CULKk16.Attributed Title: Here enduth a preyere to our lady (f. 201v)
CULKk16.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble. 
             “Another Poem by Hoccleve?” 
             Journal of English and Germanic Philology
         8 (1909): 260-6: 260-2.
